text: in a village near Delhi women mourn the
victim of a truck crash the victims
death has shattered the family
continuity Siva Prasad watch Alana Ganga
Bosco suddenly died the night before
this truck carrying more than 20 people
toppled over outside of Delhi
killing five
more than 320 people are killed in
traffic accidents every day in India
it's the highest rate in the world as
India raises billions of dollars to
expand its highways and thousands of new
drivers pour onto the road safety
experts say the number of road accidents
will soar
here roads are a maze of rickshaws cars
and pedestrians but roads are under
regulated by police and city planning
departments pedestrians weave across 32
Lane toll crossings national highway
eight is known as the expressway to
death I saw somebody lying on the road
the moment I saw his shirt then from the
shirt I could recognize that he is my
son
a truck killed this 16 year old just
after he danced at an outdoor wedding
procession him when police did not find
the driver mr. Singh took the matter
into his own hands after a few days I
was able to locate the truck that
disrespect earth which has killed my son
and I informed the police that this is
that this is not interested in catching
the truck the police say they ultimately
investigated this case and made an
arrest but they did so only with
assistance from mr. Singh's family the
truck that hit his son mr. Singh says
was carrying materials for the
construction of a new highway in India
everywhere highways are being made so
you can't keep on killing people
everywhere at Saint Stephen's Hospital
in Old Delhi the beds are full of
traffic accident victims I see more of
these in my ward earlier I would say one
or two of them with fractures in one
room nowadays I'm gonna have five six of
them in the same room with motorcycle
injuries and pedestrian injuries
this busy street in front of the
hospital is also a danger zone
the doctor personally knew three nurses
who were hit here while crossing the
road two of them died Manoj Agarwal hits
the private company that built and runs
the busiest section of the Mumbai to
Delhi expressway the most significant
constraint is about inability to take
action against habitual traffic
offenders mr. auger Vols company doesn't
have the authority to punish traffic
violators that's the job of the police
however police response is often
non-existent nobody is taking
responsibility everybody is passing the
book the driver who hit mr singh's son
was released on bail almost a year later
mr. Singh and his family continue to
struggle with their loss my wife every
day she breaks down every day every day
she will cry every day morning
I feel crying when I wake up and when
you wake up you know your son is no more
